page.title: 08TRADE
page.content: In the past,the main form of trade was fishing in The Irish Sea,but since these waters are being used illegally by certain European countries,it has resulted in fewer fish being available for the Conwy fishermen. The other main form of fishing in the river is the catching of mussels,but this decreased in recent years. The other main form of trade is tourism,with many thousands of tourists visiting each year.Due to the number of tourists visiting,there are a large number of gift shops,resulting in a smaller number of services. There are,however,a few chain stores to be found in the town.Most shops are family businesses,normally going back for many generations. Ean Davies
